Class COMP108A1Paging

java.lang.Object
COMP108A1Paging
class COMP108A1Paging
extends java.lang.Object
The implementation of four paging algorithms to be called by COMP108A1PagingApp.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    COMP108A1Paging()

  • Method Details

    • noEvict

      static COMP108A1Output noEvict​(int[] cArray, int cSize, int[] rArray, int rSize)
      An algorithm that evicts no pages from the cache.

      This function iterates through each element in the request queue.

      If the element is in the cache then it will add a hit to output.hitCount and append an "h" onto output.hitPattern.

      If the element is not in the cache then it will add a miss to output.missCount and append an "m" onto output.hitPattern.

      Parameters:
      cArray - The contents of the cache.
      cSize - The number of elements in the cache.
      rArray - An array of pending requests.
      rSize - The number of elements in the request queue.
      Returns:
      A construct of the form COMP108A1Output that contains the number of cache hits, number of cache misses and a string indicating the order of the hits and misses.

    • evictFIFO

      static COMP108A1Output evictFIFO​(int[] cArray, int cSize, int[] rArray, int rSize)
      An algorithm that evicts the number present in the cache for the longest time in the event of a miss.

      This function notes the first element in the cache and iterates through each element in the request queue.

      If the element is in the cache then it will add a hit to output.hitCount and append an "h" onto output.hitPattern.

      If the element is not in the cache then it will add a miss to output.missCount and append an "m" onto output.hitPattern.

      The cache is updated by assigning the missed value to the current first element in the cache. The first pointer is then incremented (mod cSize) to point to the next oldest value.

      Parameters:
      cArray - The contents of the cache.
      cSize - The number of elements in the cache.
      rArray - An array of pending requests.
      rSize - The number of elements in the request queue.
      Returns:
      A construct of the form COMP108A1Output that contains the number of cache hits, number of cache misses and a string indicating the order of the hits and misses.

    • evictLFU

      static COMP108A1Output evictLFU​(int[] cArray, int cSize, int[] rArray, int rSize)
      An algorithm evicts the least frequently used element of the cache in the event of a miss. If there is more than one then the left-most is used.

      This function initially sets the frequency of all elements in the cache to 1.

      If the element is in the cache then it will add a hit to output.hitCount and append an "h" onto output.hitPattern. It will then increment the frequency of the cache element that was hit. Functions.present(int, int[], int) is used to find the location of said element.

      If the element is not in the cache then it will add a miss to output.missCount and append an "m" onto output.hitPattern. It will then write the request to the least used element of the cache using Functions.lowestIndex(int[], int), and and 1 to the frequency of the same element.

      Parameters:
      cArray - The contents of the cache.
      cSize - The number of elements in the cache.
      rArray - An array of pending requests.
      rSize - The number of elements in the request queue.
      Returns:
      A construct of the form COMP108A1Output that contains the number of cache hits, number of cache misses and a string indicating the order of the hits and misses.

    • evictLFD

      static COMP108A1Output evictLFD​(int[] cArray, int cSize, int[] rArray, int rSize)
      An algorithm evicts the cache element which is requested latest in the cache.

      If the cache contains elements which are not in the request queue then that element is preferred. If there are more than one the left-most is chosen.

      Initially, the distance of all elements in the cache are set using Functions.forwardDistance(int, int[], int, int).

      If the requested element is in the cache then it will add a hit to output.hitCount and append an "h" onto output.hitPattern.

      If the element is not in the cache then it will add a miss to output.missCount and append an "m" onto output.hitPattern. It will then write the request to the cache index with the highest distance using Functions.highestIndex(int[], int).

      The distances are then refreshed using the same method they were initialised with except the request counter i is passed, to search forward from that index.

      Parameters:
      cArray - The contents of the cache.
      cSize - The number of elements in the cache.
      rArray - An array of pending requests.
      rSize - The number of elements in the request queue.
      Returns:
      A construct of the form COMP108A1Output that contains the number of cache hits, number of cache misses and a string indicating the order of the hits and misses.
